commitResults.messageTitle: Change formatting of styles that was causing compiling issues when testing

commitResults.messageBody:
Tasks are stored only in memory and are lost when the chatbot exits.

Without persistence, users cannot recover their task list across sessions.

Save tasks to disk whenever the task list changes and load them on startup.

File-based storage with a simple line format allows easy parsing and
future extension while keeping storage logic separate from task logic.

Implements ArrayList<String>-based storage and ignores runtime data
directories from version control.

Task data is lost when the chatbot exits because it is kept only in memory.

This prevents users from recovering their tasks across sessions.

Let's implement a Storage class that saves and loads ArrayList<Task> representing tasks
to a file in ./data/leo_mem.txt. The class automatically creates directories and files
if they do not exist.

Using a separate Storage class keeps storage logic independent from task and UI logic,
and a simple line-based format allows tasks to be easily reconstructed later.

Untracked runtime data directories are ignored in version control to ensure only source code is committed.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for date and time for Deadline class
commitResults.messageBody:
Deadlines and events store date and time information as plain strings.

Treating date and time values as strings prevents reliable formatting,
validation, and future date-based features.

Let's parse user input into LocalDate and LocalDateTime objects and store
them directly in task objects.

Using java.time types allows Leo to format dates consistently and reason
about deadlines in a type-safe manner, enabling future extensions such
as date-based filtering.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for loading tasks with date and time data
commitResults.messageBody:
Saved task data does not preserve date and time information explicitly.

Unstructured storage of temporal values makes task reconstruction
error-prone when loading data from disk.

Let's,
* deserialize stored data into LocalDate and LocalDateTime objects
* ensure loaded tasks remain compatible with date-based logic

Explicitly storing temporal data ensures accurate loading and supports
future extensions that rely on date and time comparisons.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Leo into modular OOP architecture
commitResults.messageBody:
Leo logic is concentrated in a single class, making it hard to
extend, test, and reason about individual responsibilities.

The tight coupling between parsing, storage, UI, and task handling
causes changes in one area to affect unrelated parts of the codebase.

Let's,
- extract Ui to handle all user interactions
- extract Storage to manage loading and saving tasks
- introduce TaskList to encapsulate task operations
- introduce Parser to convert user input into commands
- introduce a Command hierarchy to encapsulate command behavior
- organize task types into a task package

This separation improves cohesion, reduces coupling, and enables
extensible command handling via polymorphism.

commitResults.messageTitle: Move core classes into leo package
commitResults.messageBody:
Core classes are located in the default package, which makes it
harder to organize the codebase as the number of classes grows.

Keeping related classes together improves readability and
maintainability.

Let's move core classes into the leo package and remove the old
top-level files to align with Java package conventions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add JUnit tests for TaskList and Parser
commitResults.messageBody:
Add comprehensive test coverage for two core components:

Parser Tests:
- Verify all command types parse correctly
- Test case-insensitive command recognition
- Validate error handling for malformed input
- Confirm separation between parsing and execution logic

TaskList Tests:
- Test CRUD operations with realistic task objects
- Validate boundary conditions and error scenarios
- Verify task state management (mark/unmark)
- Test save format conversion for persistence

These tests provide a safety net against regressions and serve as
executable documentation for component behavior.

commitResults.messageTitle: Bug fix: Reorder code sequence causing index errors
commitResults.messageBody:
Delete command causes Ui bug off by one error, due to deletion of
tasks list before calling the getter for the same index.

Let's
- Reorder the calling of tasks.get(index) and tasks.deleteTask(index)
- capture the current task and call task.toString()

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify build.gradle from Duke to Leo
commitResults.messageBody:
Change placeholder to be used for the ip project.

Let's
- Change duke.Duke to leo.Leo
- indicate file name

commitResults.messageTitle: Add comprehensive Javadoc comments to all source files
commitResults.messageBody:
Add Javadoc documentation to all classes and public methods following
project coding standards:

Let's:
- Main Leo application class with constructor and execution flow
- Parser class for command interpretation and validation
- Storage class for file operations and data persistence
- TaskList class for task collection management
- Command hierarchy with abstract base and concrete implementations
- Task hierarchy with abstract base and concrete task types
- UI class for user interaction handling
- Custom exception class for application errors

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve code style and method organization
commitResults.messageBody:
Several classes have inconsistent formatting, naming, and method structure,
which makes the code harder to read and reason about.

This needs to change to improve maintainability and make the codebase easier
to understand and extend, especially as more commands and features are added.

Refactor code to standardize formatting, improve naming clarity, and clean up
method structure across multiple classes.

This is done without changing program behavior so that readability improves
while preserving existing functionality and test expectations.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Find command to search for tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
The application currently has no way to locate tasks once the list
grows beyond a manageable size.

Users are forced to manually scan the entire task list, which is
inefficient and error-prone.

Introduce a find command that:
* Searches tasks by description text
* Ignores leading and trailing whitespace in user input
* Returns all matching tasks instead of stopping at the first mismatch

This provides a basic but essential search capability while keeping
the command behavior consistent with typical user expectations.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix grammar issues in Ui headder comment
commitResults.messageBody:
Creates a Ui instance with scanner for user input -->
Creates an Ui instance with scanner for user input

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify Test case for exception handling
commitResults.messageBody:
LeoException for unknown command prints out UNKNOWN instead of
the unknown command. The test case did not account for the changes

Let's
- Update the test cases to the desired output

Importing CheckStyle Plugin to follow coding standards. Code that
follow a standard allow for better readability for future users.

Let's:
- Use CheckStyle to keep the current code style in line with
the coding standard
- Change current code to fit the standard

Using only CL interface for textbot interface may not give a good
UX, using a GUI gives a better interface for users.

Let's
- Implement a DialogBox
- Implement a Main and MainWindow stage
- Implement FXML to better organise UX parameters
Commited the wrong implementation of MainWindow.fxml

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix CheckStyle issues for Main and DialogBox

commitResults.messageBody:
Commands within the parse method contain a way to separate
multi-parameter commands with singular-command parameters.

The programmer may accidentally add a multi-parameter command into the
singular-command parameter condition, causing mult-param commands to
accept incorrect parts of a command. This error may cause null pointer
exceptions during runtime.

Let's add assertion to all multi-param commands to check if there exists
multiple parameters. The assertion check for single-param commands and
informs the programmer what command is facing issues.

Adding assertions

commitResults.messageTitle: Add assert to Storage, Leo, TaskList and UI class
commitResults.messageBody:
There are certain objects being used that could result in missing
or null cases, due to not returning the correct values. For instance,
UI issueus like calling showLeoReply method with null string values,
due to null messages.

We prevent this by addding assertion to methods that involve interal
computations.

Let's
- Add assert cases for methods that involve internal modifications
including showLeoReply, showError
- Add assert barriers when attempting to convert tasklist into save
format, by assessing if tasklist contain null values.

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify Code Quality of Command classes
commitResults.messageBody:
The command classes contains code that violates SLAP, such as having
multiple functions within the extract method, and magic strings to
create format

Improving code quality by creating methods to separate functionalities
and using string finals to represent string literals improves code
readability.

Let's:
- Use refactoring method: Extract Method to improve code readability
- Use String finals to replace magic strings
- Use appropriate guard clauses

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify Code Quality for Task type classes
commitResults.messageBody:
The toString() method of current Task type classes uses magic
strings.

Using magic strings could reduce readability to future developers,
such as not understanding the purpose of the strings.

Let's
- use string finals to label magic strings

The parse command contain multiple levels of abstraction which violates
SLAP principles.

To remain single level of abstraction, helper methods have been created
to mamintain similar high level statements within the parse method.

Let's:
- Create helper methods to replace low level statements with higher
level statements
Branch a assertions
Branch a code quality

There were conflicts with code quality format that disallows
assertion

The tasks had no function to prevent conflicting timeslots, allowing
for schedules to conflict.

The new interview feature uses a separate Interview Task to identify
any conflicting dates that prevent storing of multiple Interview Tasks
within the same tasklist.

Let's
- Create a new task and command to support conflicting schedules

commitResults.messageTitle: Add better error handling message for Parser

commitResults.messageBody:
The GUI of the chatbot was only a placeholder. There was a lack of
intuitive features like distinguishing Leo's dialogue and the user.
Errors were also not highlighted in a different form.

The new GUI highlights these differences to improve the user
experience.

Let's
- Add a better GUI colour scheme to improve the chatbox's design
- Differentiate Leo and the user's dialogue
- Highlight error messages by differentianting colours from the user

commitResults.messageTitle: Add corrupt save file error handling in Storage
commitResults.messageBody:
The exception thrown did not gracefully handle corrupt save files
which causes the program to crash. This would cause any error in save
files to make the program not run.

Informing the user of the error and automatically creating a new task
list allows the program to run independant of the corrupted save file.

Let's
- Add a startup message in the GUI to inform the user of the issues
- Create a new task when corruption occurs to prevent fatal crash

Modify MainWindow GUI to add prompt text
